summary.long: Job is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God and departed from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His substance was seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen, five hundred she asses, and a very great store of servants, so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sons went and had banquets in their houses, each one on his day, and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so, when the days of their banquets were over, that Job sent and sanctified them and rose up early in the morning and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all; for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned and blasphemed God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Satan, Where dost thou come from? Then Satan answered the LORD and said, From going to and fro in the earth and from walking up and down in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my slave Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that fears God and has departed from evil?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan answered the LORD and said, Does Job fear God for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou not made a hedge about him and about his house and about all that he has on every side? Thou hast blessed the work of his hands; therefore, his substance has increased in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put forth thy hand now and touch all that he has, and thou shalt see if he will not blaspheme thee to thy face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said to Satan, Behold, all that he has is in thy power; only upon himself do not put forth thy hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their brother, the firstborn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a messenger came unto Job and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Sabeans {Heb. those of Sheba} fell upon them and took them away; they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, another came who said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven and has burned up the sheep and the servants and consumed them; and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, another came and said, The Chaldeans made three bands and fell upon the camels and have carried them away and have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there another came and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their brother, the firstborn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job arose and rent his mantle and shaved his head and fell down upon the ground and worshipped
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return there. The LORD gave, and the LORD has taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all this Job did not sin nor charge God with folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them to present himself before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Satan, Where dost thou come from? And Satan answered the LORD and said, From going to and fro in the earth and from walking up and down in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my slave Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that fears God and has departed from evil and that he still retains his perfection, although thou didst incite me against him to destroy him without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan answered the LORD and said, Skin for skin, all that a man has he will give for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put forth thy hand now and touch his bone and his flesh, and thou shalt see if he does not blaspheme thee to thy face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Satan, Behold, he is in thy hand, but preserve his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Satan went forth from the presence of the LORD and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto the crown of his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took a potsherd to scratch himself with, and he was sitting among the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his wife said unto him, Dost thou still retain thine integrity? Blaspheme God and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto her, Thou hast spoken as any of the foolish women speak. What? Shall we receive good at the hand of God and shall we not receive evil? In all this Job did not sin with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now three friends of Job, Eliphaz, the Temanite, Bildad, the Shuhite, and Zophar, the Naamathite, when they heard of all this evil that had come upon him, each one came from his own place; for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they lifted up their eyes afar off and knew him not, they lifted up their voice and wept; and each one rent his mantle and sprinkled dust upon his head toward heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down with him upon the ground seven days and seven nights, and no one spoke a word unto him; for they saw that his grief was very great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Job opened his mouth and cursed his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job spoke and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the day perish in which I was born and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above; neither let the light shine upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death redeem it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year; let it not come into the number of the months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O, let that night be solitary; let no song come therein!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the stars of its dawn be darkened; they waited for light, but have none; neither let them see the dawning of the day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it did not shut up the doors of my mother’s womb nor hide the misery from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did I not die from the womb? Why did I not give up the spirit when I came out of the belly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did the knees receive me? Of what use the breasts that I should suck?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now I should have lain still and been quiet; I should have slept; then I would have been at rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the kings and the counsellors of the earth, who built desolate places for themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or, why was I not hidden as an untimely birth, as infants who never saw light?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary are at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the prisoners rest together, they do not hear the voice of the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The small and the great are there, and the slave is free from his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who long for death, but it comes not; and search for it more than for hid treasures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who rejoice exceedingly and are glad when they can find the grave;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the man who does not know which way he goes and whom God has hedged in?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my sighing comes before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I never had prosperity, nor did I secure myself, neither was I at rest; yet trouble came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz, the Temanite, answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we attempt to commune with thee, thou wilt be grieved. But who can withhold himself from speaking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy words have upheld the one that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that it is come upon thee, thou art grieved; it touches thee, and thou art troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the integrity of thy ways?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? Or where were the righteous cut off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as I have seen, those that plow iniquity and sow wickedness, reap the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the breath of God they perish, and by the spirit of his anger they are consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The roaring of the lion and the voice of the fierce lion and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The old lion perishes for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the matter was also hidden from me, but my ear has perceived a little of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In imaginations of visions of the night, when deep sleep falls upon men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fear came upon me and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a spirit passed before me which caused the hair of my flesh to stand up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A ghost stood in front of me, whose face I did not recognize, and I heard it say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his maker?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he put no trust in his slaves, and his angels he charged with folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much more with those that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, who shall be crushed by the moth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are destroyed from morning to evening; they perish for ever without anyone regarding it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does their beauty perish with them? They die and do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Call now, if there shall be anyone to answer thee; and if there shall be any of the saints for thee to look unto?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is certain that wrath kills the foolish man, and envy consumes the covetous one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen the foolish taking root, but at the same time I cursed his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons are far from saving health, and they shall be crushed in the gate, and there shall be no one to deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hungry shall eat up his harvest, and even take it out from among the thorns, and the thirsty shall drink up their substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the iniquity does not come forth out of the dust; neither does chastisement spring up out of the ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would certainly seek God, and unto God would I commit my affairs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who does great things that no one can understand, and marvels that have no explanation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gives rain upon the earth and sends waters abroad;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who sets up the humble on high, that those who mourn may be lifted up with saving health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He frustrates the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes the wise in their own prudence, and the counsel of his adversaries is turned to folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They meet with darkness in the daytime and grope in the noonday as in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he saves the poor from the sword, from the mouth of the wicked, and from the hand of the violent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the hope of the poor, and iniquity closes her mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, blessed is the man whom God chastens; therefore, do not despise not the correction of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he makes sore, and binds up; he wounds, and his hands make whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall deliver thee in six tribulations, and in the seventh no evil shall touch thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In famine he shall ransom thee from death, and in war from the power of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue; neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh; neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field; and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt know that there is peace in thy tent, and thou shalt visit thy habitation and shalt not sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt know that thy seed is great and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like a shock of wheat that is gathered in its season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold that which we have searched out, so it is; hear it and judge it for thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh that my grief and calamity were justly weighed and laid equally in the balances!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it would be heavier than the sand of the sea; therefore, my words are swallowed up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me; my spirit drinks of the poison; and terrors of God combat me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the wild ass bray when he has grass? Does the ox low over his fodder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The things that my soul refused to touch before, now by my sorrow are my food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, that I might have my request and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even that it would please God to destroy me, that he would let loose his hand and cut me off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then should my comfort grow; I would hold on to sorrow without mercy; for I have not contradicted the words of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is my strength that I should hope? What is my end that I should prolong my life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of steel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I not doing all that I can, and even with all this I lack the power to do anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is afflicted deserves mercy from his friend; but he has forsaken the fear of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My brethren have lied to me as a brook; they passed away as an impetuous stream,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which was hidden by ice and covered by snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which in the time of heat, they vanish; when they are heated, they disappear out of their place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they turn aside out of the paths of their way; they go to nothing and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The travelers of Tema looked; the traveling companies of Sheba waited for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were put to shame because of their hope; they came there and found them confused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now ye are certainly as they; ye have seen the torment and are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I say, Bring unto me and pay for me out of your substance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and deliver me from the enemy’s hand and ransom me from the hand of the mighty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach me, and I will be silent; and cause me to understand in what I have erred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How forcible are the words of rectitude! But what does your argument reprove?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are ye not thinking up words of reproof and throw to the wind words that are lost?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye also overwhelm the fatherless and dig a pit before your friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, if ye desire, look upon me and see if I shall lie in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn now, and there is no iniquity; return again to look for my righteousness in this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is iniquity in my tongue or if my taste cannot discern the torments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man certainly has an appointed amount of time upon earth, and his days are like the days of a hireling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a slave earnestly desires the shade and as a hireling waits for rest from his work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so I am made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise? I measure the night, and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken and abominable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle and are spent without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember thou that my life is wind and that my eyes shall not return to see good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eyes of those that see me now shall not see me again; thine eyes shall be upon me, and I will cease to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the cloud is consumed and vanishes away, so he that goes down to Sheol, who shall not come up again;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall return no more to his house; neither shall his place know him any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I a sea, or a dragon, that thou settest a watch over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou dost scare me with dreams and terrify me with visions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my soul thought it better to be strangled and desired death more than my bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I loathed life; I do not desire to live for ever; let me alone; for my days are vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is man that thou should magnify him and that thou should set thine heart upon him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that thou should visit him every morning and try him every moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone until I swallow down my spittle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have sinned, what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? Why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why dost thou not take away my rebellion and pass over my iniquity? For now I shall sleep in the dust; and if thou shalt seek me in the morning, I shall not be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad, the Shuhite, answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long wilt thou speak such things and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall God pervert that which is right or shall the Almighty pervert justice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because thy sons sinned against him, he cast them away in the place of their rebellion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou would seek God early and make thy supplication to the Almighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou wert pure and upright, surely now he would awake upon thee and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In such a way that thy beginning would have been small, in comparison to the great increase of thy latter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ask, I pray thee, of the former age, and be willing to enquire of thy fathers regarding them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we are but of yesterday and know nothing because our days upon earth are as a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall they not teach thee and tell thee and utter these words out of their heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can the rush grow up without mire? Can the meadow grow without water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whilst it is yet in its greenness and not cut down, it withers before any other herb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So are the paths of all that forget God, and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For his hope shall be cut off, and his trust is a spider’s web.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand; he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a tree, he is green before the sun, and his branches go forth over his garden;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his roots weave themselves around a spring and secure themselves even in a stony place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he is uprooted from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth from where he was transplanted, others shall grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man; neither will he help the evil doers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will yet fill thy mouth with laughing and thy lips with shouts of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those that hate thee shall be clothed with shame, and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know it is so of a truth, but how shall a man be justified with God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he desires to contend with him, he will not be able to answer him one thing of a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is wise in heart and mighty in strength; who has hardened himself against him and remained in peace?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who uproots the mountains in his anger, and they know not who overturned them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who removes the earth out of her place and causes her pillars to tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who commands the sun, and it rises not; and seals up the stars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He alone extends the heavens and walks upon the waves of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who made Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the secret places of the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who does great things past finding out, and wonders without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he shall pass before me, and I shall not see him; and he shall pass on, and I shall not understand him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he shall take away, who can cause him to restore? Who shall say unto him, What doest thou?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God will not withdraw his anger, and under him those who help, unto pride are bent over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less shall I answer him and choose out my words to reason with him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who even though I am righteous, yet I would not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who if I were to invoke him, and he answered me; yet I would not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has broken me with a tempest and has multiplied my wounds without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not suffer me to take my breath but has filled me with bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we were to speak of his strength, he is certainly strong; and if of his judgment, who shall cause us to meet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I justify myself, my own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, he shall prove me perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I say I am imperfect, I know not my soul; I would condemn my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One thing remains, that I say, He consumes the perfect and the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is the scourge, it slays suddenly, and it does not laugh at the trial of the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked; he covers the faces of its judges; if it is not he who does this then, who is it and where is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now my days are swifter than a post; they fled away, they never saw good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are passed away as the ships of Ebeh {Heb. reed} as the eagle that throws himself on the prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness and comfort myself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid of all my troubles; I know that thou wilt not hold me guiltless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am wicked, why then shall I toil in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I wash myself with snow water and make my hands never so clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet thou shalt plunge me into the pit, and my own clothes shall abhor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together unto judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is there any arbiter between us, that might lay his hand upon us both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him take his tormentor away from me, and his terror will not perturb me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I would speak and not fear him, because in this state I am not myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul is cut off in my life; therefore, I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; cause me to understand why thou dost contend with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it good unto thee that thou should oppress, that thou should reject the work of thine hands and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou eyes of flesh? Dost thou see as man sees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are thy days as the days of man? Are thy years as man’s days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou dost enquire after my iniquity and search after my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is no one that can deliver out of thy hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine hands have formed me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember now that thou hast formed me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou not poured me out as milk and curdled me like cheese?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh and hast hedged me with bones and sinews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast granted me life and mercy, and thy visitation has kept my spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things thou hast hid in thine heart; I know that this is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I sinned, wilt thou mark me and not cleanse me from my iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am wicked, woe unto me; and if I am righteous, I will not lift up my head, being full of dishonour and of seeing my affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou dost increase. Thou dost hunt me as a fierce lion; turning and doing marvels in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost renew thy plagues against me and increase thine indignation upon me, bringing up armies against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the spirit and no eye had seen me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not my days few? Cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: before I go, to not return, to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: land of darkness, as darkness itself, and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zophar, the Naamathite, answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should thy lies make men be silent? Shalt thou mock, and shall no man make thee ashamed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean before thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But oh, that God would speak and open his lips against thee
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he would show thee the secrets of wisdom! For thou dost deserve double according to sound wisdom; and thou dost know that God has forgotten thee because of thine iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou by searching find out God? Canst thou come unto the perfection of the Almighty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is higher than the heavens; what canst thou do? It is deeper than Sheol; how canst thou know it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The measure of it is longer than the earth and broader than the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he cuts off, or shuts up, or gathers together, then who can hinder him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knows the vain men; and he sees the iniquity; will he not then understand it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The vain man shall make himself understood, though man is born like a wild ass’s colt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou would prepare thine heart and stretch out thine hands toward him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if there is any iniquity in thy hand and thou dost put it far away and dost not consent that wickedness dwell in thy habitations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; thou shalt be strongly established and shalt not fear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt forget thy misery and remember it as waters that passed away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thine age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt trust because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig and sleep in safety;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou shalt lie down, and no one shall make thee afraid; and many shall make requests unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the eyes of the wicked shall consume themselves, and they shall have no refuge, and their hope shall be agony of the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a heart as well as you; I am not inferior to you; and who shall not be able to say as much again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who invokes God and he answers him is mocked by his friend; the just and perfect man is laughed to scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The torch is held in low esteem in the thought of him that is prosperous, which was prepared to guard against a slip of the feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tents of robbers are at ease, and those that provoke God and those who carry gods in their hands live secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the heavens, and they shall show thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee; the fishes of the sea shall declare it unto thee also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What thing of all these does not know that the hand of the LORD made them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his hand is the soul of every living thing and the spirit of all flesh of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly the ear proves words and the mouth tastes foods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days intelligence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him is wisdom and strength; he has counsel and intelligence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he shall break down, and it shall not be built again; he shall shut up a man, and no one shall be able to open unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he shall withhold the waters, and they shall dry up; also he shall send them forth, and they shall destroy the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him is strength and existence; he who errs and he who leads astray are his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He causes the counsellors to walk away stripped of counsel and makes the judges to be fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looses the bond of kings and girds their loins with a girdle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He leads priests away spoiled and overthrows the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He impedes the lips of those that speak the truth and takes away the counsel of the aged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He pours contempt upon princes and weakens the strength of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He uncovers the depths of the darkness and brings out to light the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He multiplies the Gentiles and destroys them; he scatters the Gentiles and gathers them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes away the heart of the heads of the people of the earth and causes them to become lost, wandering without a way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They grope in the darkness and not the light, and he causes them to err like drunken men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, my eyes have seen all this; my ears have heard and understood it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you know it, I know it; I am not inferior unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I would speak with the Almighty, and I desired to dispute with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That ye are certainly forgers of lies; ye are all physicians of no value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O that ye would altogether be silent! And it would be unto you instead of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear now my dispute, and hearken to the arguments of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are ye to speak iniquity for God? Are ye to speak deceitfully for him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are ye to bring honour unto him? Are ye to contend for God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Would it be good for him to search you out? As one man mocks another, do ye so mock him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will reprove you severely, if in secret you give him such honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly his excellency should make you afraid, and his dread should fall upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your memories shall be compared unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to me, and I will speak, and afterward let come on me what will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why shall I take my flesh in my teeth and put my life in the palm of my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though he slay me, yet I will trust in him; but I will defend my ways before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also shall be my saving health; for the hypocrite shall not enter into his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear diligently my reason and my declaration with your ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold now, if I draw near unto the judgment; I know that I shall be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is he that will contend with me? For now, if I remain silent, I shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the least, grant me these two things; then I will not hide myself from thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: withdraw thy hand from me; and let not thy dread make me afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then call, and I will answer; or let me speak, and answer thou me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How many are my iniquities and sins? Make me to know my transgression and my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why dost thou hide thy face, and hold me for thine enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? Wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why dost thou write bitter things against me and make me carry the iniquities of my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost put my feet also in the stocks and look narrowly unto all my paths; thou dost set a print upon the heels of my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And man, is as a rotten thing that is being consumed, as a garment that is moth eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man that is born of a woman is of few days and full of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He comes forth like an open flower and is cut down; he flees as a shadow and does not remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such a one and bring me into judgment with thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? No one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou should leave him, he will cease to exist; until then, he shall desire, as a hireling, his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is yet hope for a tree, if it is cut down, that it will sprout again and that its tender branch will not cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though its root waxes old in the earth and its trunk is dead in the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the scent of water it will bud and bring forth boughs like a new plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when man shall die and be cut off, and the man shall perish, where shall he be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters from the sea went, and the river ran out, it dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So man lies down and does not rise; until there is no heaven, they shall not awake nor be raised out of their sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O that thou would hide me in Sheol, that thou would keep me covered until thy wrath is past, that thou would appoint me a set time and remember me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man dies, shall he live again? All the days of my appointed time I will wait until my transformation comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then thou shalt call, and I will answer thee; thou wilt have a desire towards the work of thine hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now thou dost number my steps; thou dost not open up my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou dost sew up my iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certainly the mountain that falls is undone, and the rocks are removed out of their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The impetuous waters break the stones and wash away the dust of the earth; in like manner thou dost cause man to lose hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt be stronger than him for ever, and he passes; thou dost change his countenance and send him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons shall be honoured and he shall not know of it; or they shall be afflicted, but he shall not perceive of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while his flesh is upon him, he shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz, the Temanite, answered, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge and fill his belly with the east wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should he dispute with useless words and with reasons that are not profitable?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost also cast off fear and undermine prayer before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy mouth has declared thine iniquity, and thou hast chosen the tongue of the crafty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine own mouth shall condemn thee, and not I; thine own lips shall testify against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wast thou born before Adam? Or wast thou formed before the hills?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God, that thou dost detain wisdom in thee alone?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What dost thou know that we do not? What dost thou understand, which is not in us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among us are also gray hairs; there are also aged men, much elder than thy father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are the consolations of God in such small esteem with thee? Is there by chance any secret thing concerning thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why does thine heart carry thee away, and why do thine eyes blink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou dost reply unto God with thy spirit and bring forth such words out of thy mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is man that he should be clean and that he that is born of a woman should be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he puts no trust in his saints, and not even the heavens are clean in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less the man who is abominable and filthy, who drinks iniquity like water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to me and I will show thee and declare unto thee that which I have seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that which the wise men have told us of their fathers and have not hid it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked man travails with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden from the violent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fearful sounds are in his ears; in peace the destroyer shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not believe that he shall return out of darkness, and he is always watching the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wanders abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? He knows that the day of darkness is prepared for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tribulation and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he extended his hand against God and strengthens himself against the Almighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall run him through in the neck, upon the thick shoulder pieces of his shields;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he covered his face with his fatness and made collops of fat on his flanks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he dwelt in desolate cities and in houses which no one inhabited, which were in heaps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not become rich, nor shall his strength be established, neither shall he extend his beauty upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not escape from the darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth he shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not be established; in vanity he shall err; therefore, he shall be changed into vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be cut off before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall shake off his sour grapes as the vine and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the congregation of the hypocrites shall be made desolate, and fire shall consume the tents of bribery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They conceive pain and bring forth iniquity, and their belly meditates deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many times I have heard such things; miserable comforters are ye all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall vain words have an end? Or what is it that emboldens thee to answer?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also could speak as ye do. I wish your soul were in my soul’s stead, that I could heap up words against you and shake my head at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the consolation of my lips would assuage the pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though if I speak, my pain does not cease; and if I forbear to speak, it does not depart from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now he has made me weary; thou hast made desolate all my company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me bears witness to my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His wrath has torn me and has been against me; he gnashed upon me with his teeth; my enemy sharpened his eyes upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have opened their mouth against me; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has delivered me unto the liar, and in the hands of the wicked he has caused me to tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was prosperous, but he has broken me asunder; he has taken me by my neck and shaken me to pieces and set me up for his mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His archers compassed me round about; he cleaved my kidneys asunder and did not spare; he poured out my gall upon the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He broke me with breach upon breach; he ran upon me like a giant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sewn sackcloth upon my skin and put dust over my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even though there is no injustice in my hands, and my prayer has been pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O earth, do not cover my blood; and let there be no place where my cry is hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly my witness is even now in the heavens, and my record is on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who dispute with me are my friends, but my eyes shall pour out tears unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O that a man might dispute with God, as he can with his neighbour!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the counted years are come, then I shall go the way from which I shall not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My breath is corrupt, my days are cut off, and the grave is ready for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there are only mockers with me, upon whose bitterness my eye continues to gaze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put up now, give me surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For with these, thou hast hid their heart from understanding; therefore, thou shalt not exalt them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that speaks flattery to his neighbour, even the eyes of his sons shall fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has made me a byword of the peoples; and before them I have been as a tambourine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes are dim by reason of sorrow, and all my thoughts are as a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous shall hold on to his way, and he that has clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But return all of you, and come now; for I shall not find one that is wise among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My days are past, my thoughts were broken off, even the purposes of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They changed the night into day; the light is short because of the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I wait, Sheol is my house; I have made my bed in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have said to the pit, Thou art my father; to the worms, my mother, and my sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And where shall my hope be now? As for my hope, who shall see it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall go down to the bars of Sheol, and together they shall rest in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad, the Shuhite, answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? Understand, and afterwards we will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are we counted as beasts? Are we vile in your sight?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O thou that dost tear thy soul in thine anger; shall the earth be forsaken because of thee and shall the rocks be removed out of their place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the wicked shall certainly be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his lamp shall be put out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The steps of his strength shall be cut down, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a net shall be cast at his feet, and he shall walk upon a network.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The snare shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cord is hidden in the ground and a trap for him in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and his own feet shall drive him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall devour the protection of his skin; the firstborn of death shall devour his members.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tent, and he shall be brought to the king of terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall dwell in his tent, as if it were not his; brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above his branch shall be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His memory shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be driven from the light into the darkness and chased out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall have neither son nor grandson among his people, nor any to succeed him in his dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those that come after him shall be dismayed at his day, as those that went before were overcome with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that does not know God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job replied and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will ye anguish my soul and break me in pieces with words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These ten times ye have reproached me; are ye not ashamed to make yourselves strange to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if indeed I have erred, my error shall remain with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me and reprove me of my reproach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: know now that God has overthrown me and has compassed me with his net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I shall cry out that I have been wronged, and I shall not be heard; I shall cry aloud, and there shall be no judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has walled off my way and I shall not pass, and he has set darkness in my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has stripped me of my glory and taken the crown from my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has pulled me up on every side, and I am dried up; he has caused my hope to pass like an uprooted tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has kindled his wrath against me, and he counted me unto him as one of his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His troops came together and raised up their way over me and encamp round about my tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has put my brethren far from me, and my acquaintances are verily estranged from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those that dwell in my house and my maids have counted me for a stranger; I was an alien in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I called my slave, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My spirit came to be strange to my wife, although I intreated her for the sons of my own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the young children despised me; as I arose, they spoke against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All my intimate friends abhorred me; and those whom I loved are turned against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bones cleave to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God has touched me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do ye persecute me as God and are not satisfied with my flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, that my words were now written! Oh, that they were printed in a book!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that my redeemer lives and that he shall rise at the latter day over the dust;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and afterward from this, my stricken skin and from my own flesh, I must see God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I shall see for myself, and my eyes shall behold, and not another, though my kidneys be consumed within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye should say, Why should we persecute him, seeing that the root of the matter is found in me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye afraid of the sword; for the wrath of the sword comes because of the iniquities, that ye may know there is a judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zophar, the Naamathite, answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My thoughts certainly cause me to answer, and therefore, I make haste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my intelligence causes me to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou not know this that always was, since man was placed upon earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though his excellency mounts up to the heavens, and his head reaches unto the clouds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung; those who have seen him shall say, What is become of him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall fly away as a dream and shall not be found: yea, he shall flee away as a vision of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place behold him any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His poor sons shall go forth begging, and their hands shall restore that which he stole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His bones are full of the sins of his youth, which shall be buried with him in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If wickedness was sweet in his mouth, if he hid it under his tongue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if it seemed good unto him, and he did not forsake it, but savored it within his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his food shall be changed in his bowels, it shall be the gall of asps within him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has swallowed down riches, but he shall vomit them up again; God shall cast them out of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall suck the poison of asps; the viper’s tongue shall slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall restore the work that was not his; according to the substance that he took; neither shall he devour, nor rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he oppressed and forsook the poor; because he has violently taken away houses which he did not build,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, he shall not feel quietness in his belly; he shall not escape with that which he desired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing is left that he did not eat; therefore, his goods shall not last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fullness of his sufficiency, he shall come into anguish; the hands of all the wicked shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him and shall rain it upon him and upon his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall flee from the weapons of iron, and the bow of bronze shall strike him through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall draw forth an arrow from his quiver, and like lightning it shall strike through his gall; terrors shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All darkness is kept for his secrets; a fire not blown shall consume him; his successor shall be broken in his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The increase of his house shall be taken captive; they shall be scattered in the day of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the portion of a wicked man from God and the heritage that God appoints unto him by his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be instead of your consolations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suffer me that I may speak; and after I have spoken, mock on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, is my complaint to man? And if so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look upon me and be astonished and lay your hand upon your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even I myself, when I remember, I am afraid, and trembling takes hold on my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do the wicked live and become old and even increase in riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their seed is with them, established in their sight, and their offspring before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their houses are safe from fear; neither is the rod of God upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their cows conceive, and do not abort; their cows calve and do not cast forth their young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock of sheep, and their children dance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They jump at the sound of the timbrel and harp and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spend their days in pleasure and in a moment go down to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, they say unto God, Depart from us; for we do not desire the knowledge of thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the Almighty that we should serve him? And what profit should we have if we pray unto him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold that their good is not in their hands; the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How often is the lamp of the wicked put out and their destruction comes upon them, and God distributes sorrows upon them in his anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be as stubble before the wind and as chaff taken up by the whirlwind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God shall lay up his violence for their sons; and he will reward him so that he shall know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what delight shall he have in his house after him, being cut off in the number of his months?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall he teach God knowledge, seeing he judges those that are high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one shall die in the full strength of his beauty, being completely at ease and quiet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another dies in the bitterness of his soul, never having eaten with pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I know your thoughts and the imaginations which ye devise against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye say, What is of the house of the prince, and what of the tent of the habitation of the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye not asked those that go by the way, and do ye not know their tokens?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That the wicked is reserved for the day of destruction, they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he has done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall yet be brought to the grave and shall remain in the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clods of the river valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall be drawn after him, as there were innumerable before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then do ye comfort me in vain, given that your answers remain as falsehood?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz, the Temanite, answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a man be profitable unto God? For he that is wise is profitable unto himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty that thou art justified? Or is it gain to him that thou makest thy ways perfect?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he reprove thee or will he enter with thee into judgment because he fears thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly thy wickedness is great and thine iniquities have no end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou didst take a pledge from thy brother without cause and stripped the naked of their clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou didst not give water to drink to the weary, and thou hast withheld bread from the hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man of means had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast sent the widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubles thee
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or darkness, that thou canst not see, and abundance of waters cover thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not God in the height of the heavens? Behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt say, What does God know? How can he judge through the darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thick clouds are his hiding place, and he does not see; and he walks in the circuit of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou desire to keep the old way which wicked men have trodden?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who said unto God, Depart from us; and what can the Almighty do unto us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had filled their houses with good things. Therefore, the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous shall see it and be glad; and the innocent laughs them to scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereas our substance was not cut down, when the fire had consumed the rest of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make up thy friendship now with him, and thou shalt have peace; thereby good shall come unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou shalt lay up gold as dust and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee; and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When others are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent; and in the pureness of thine hands thou shalt be kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I will also speak with bitterness; my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, that I knew where I might find him! That I might come even to his seat!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would order judgment before him and fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would know the words which he would answer me and understand what he would say unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he plead against me with his great power? No, but rather he would put it in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the righteous might dispute with him; and should I escape for ever from the one who condemns me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I shall go to the east and not find him; and to the west, but I cannot perceive him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he is working to the north, I shall not see him; to the south, he hides himself, that I shall not see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he has known the way that I take; he has tried me, and I have come forth as gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My feet have held to his steps, I have kept his way, and have not departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither have I separated myself from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he determines something, who can turn him? His soul desired it, and he did it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, he will finish that which is necessary for me; and there are many such things in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I shall fear before his face; I shall consider, and I shall fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has made my heart tender, and the Almighty has frightened me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why was I not cut off before the darkness, neither has he covered my face with the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why, seeing that times are not hidden from the Almighty, do those that know him not see his days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks and feed thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drive away the ass of the fatherless; they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turn the needy out of the way; and all the poor of the earth hide themselves from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, they go forth to their work, rising early for a prey; the wilderness yields food for them and for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the field they reap their fodder, and the wicked gather the vintage that is not theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are wet with the floods of the mountains and embrace the rock for want of a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They pluck the fatherless from the breast and take a pledge of the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cause the naked to go without clothing, and they take away the sheaves from the hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They press oil within their walls and tread their winepresses and suffer thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men groan from out of the city, and the souls of the dead cry out; yet God did not hinder them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are among those that rebel against the light; they have never known its ways nor abided in its paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The murderer rises with the light, kills the poor and the needy, and in the night is as a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me; and disguises his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime; they do not know the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death; if they are known, the terrors of the shadow of death come over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are swift upon the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth; they never come by the way of the vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Drought and heat consume the snow waters; so does Sheol consume those who have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Merciful One shall forget them; the worm shall feed sweetly on them; they shall never be remembered again; and iniquity shall be broken as a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He afflicted the barren woman that did not conceive and never did good unto the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He furthered the violent with his power; he did not lend to anyone in his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he gave credit to some to take them over, his eyes were upon their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all others and cut off as the tops of the heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it is not so now, who will make me a liar or reduce my speech to nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad, the Shuhite, answered, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dominion and fear are with God; he makes peace in his high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there any number to his armies? And upon whom does his light not arise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then can man be justified with God? Or how can he that is born of a woman be clean?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, even the moon shall not shine, neither are the stars pure in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less man, who is as a worm, and the son of man, who is also a worm?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How hast thou helped the one who has no power? Hast thou saved with thy arm the one who has no strength?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How hast thou counselled the one that has no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom hast thou uttered words, and whose is the spirit that comes forth from thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dead things are formed under the waters and of its dwelling places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheol is naked before him, and hell has no covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stretches out the north wind over the empty place and hangs the earth upon nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He binds up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He holds back the face of his throne and spreads his cloud upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has compassed the waters with bounds until the end of light and darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He divides the sea with his power, and by his intelligence he smites its pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his spirit he has adorned the heavens; his hand has formed the fleeing serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these are parts of his ways; but how little a portion have we heard of him? For the thunder of his power, who shall understand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Job continued his parable and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As God lives, who has taken away my rights; and the Almighty, who has made my soul bitter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that all the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: my lips shall not speak iniquity, nor my tongue utter deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
