verses.text: In no wise should I justify you; until I die I will not remove my integrity from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hold fast to my righteousness and will not let it go; my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let my enemy be as the wicked and my adversary as the unrighteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he has stolen much, when God takes away his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will God hear his cry when the tribulation comes upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? Will he always call upon God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will teach you what there is in the hand of God; I will not conceal that which is regarding the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye so completely vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the portion of a wicked man with God and the heritage of the violent, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If their sons are multiplied, it is for the sword; and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death; and their widows shall not weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though he heaps up silver as the dust and prepares raiment as the clay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built his house as a moth and as a booth that the keeper makes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered; he shall open his eyes and not see anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terrors shall take hold on him as waters; a whirlwind shall carry him away in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The east wind shall take him away, and he shall depart; the storm shall catch him up out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God shall cast down on him and not spare; he would attempt to flee out of his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men shall clap their hands at him, and from his place they shall hiss at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely there is a mine for the silver, and a place for gold where they refine it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron is taken out of the dust, and bronze is melted out of the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set a border unto the darkness, and unto every perfect work that he made, he placed a stone of darkness and shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The river breaks forth next to the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot, that were higher than man, are gone away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Land out of which bread comes forth, and underneath it shall be as if it were converted in fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A place where its stones shall be sapphires; and it shall have dust of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A path which no fowl knows and which the vulture’s eye has never seen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the young of the proud have not trodden it, nor has the fierce lion passed by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put his hand upon the flint and overturned the mountains from the root.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cut rivers out of the rocks; and his eye saw every precious thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He detained the rivers in their source and caused that which was hid to be brought to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man never knew its price; neither is it found in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The deep saith, It is not in me; and the sea saith, It is not with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for its price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx or the sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gold cannot equal it, nor can diamond; neither shall it be exchanged for vessels of fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls; for wisdom is better than precious stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The emerald of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where then does wisdom come from? And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living and kept concealed from every fowl of the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hell and death say, We have heard its fame with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God understands its way, and he alone knows its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he looks unto the ends of the earth and sees under the whole heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To make a weight for the wind and to supply water by measure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when he made a law for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he saw it and counted it; he prepared it and also searched it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto man he said, Behold, that the fear of the Lord, is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Job continued his parable and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when his lamp shone upon my head, and by its light I walked in the darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as I was in the days of my youth, when God was familiar in my tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went out to the gate to judgment, when I had my seat prepared in the plaza!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men would see me and hide themselves, and the aged would arise and stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes would refrain from talking and lay their hand on their mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the voice of the principals would not be noticed, and their tongue would cleave to the roof of their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ears that heard me, called me blessed; and when the eyes that saw me, gave witness to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I delivered the poor that cried and the fatherless who had no one to help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blessing of the one that was ready to perish came upon me; and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me as a robe; and my diadem was judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was eyes to the blind and feet to the lame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a father to the needy; and the cause which I did not know I searched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I broke the fangs of the wicked and caused their teeth to release the prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My root is spread out by the waters, and the dew shall remain upon my branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My glory is renewed with me, and my bow is renewed in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would hear me and wait, and keep silent at my counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After my words they would not reply, but my reason dropped upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they waited for me as for the rain, and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I laughed at them, they did not believe it; and they did not cast down the light of my countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I approved their way and sat at the head and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforts the mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now those that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, unto what might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom time was lost?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For want and famine they walked alone; fleeing into solitude, to the dark place, desolate and waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who cut up mallows among the bushes and juniper roots for their food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were driven forth from among men (they cried after them as after a thief).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They dwelt in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were sons of fools and men without names; they were lower than the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I am their song, and I am their byword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They abhor me, they distance themselves from me, and do not spare to spit in my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because God has loosed my cord and afflicted me, they have also gone out of control before my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast down my path, they took advantage of my calamity, against them there was no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came in as through a wide breach; they were stirred up because of my calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have loosed terrors upon me; they fought my will as the wind and my saving health as a cloud that passes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bones pierce me in the night, and my sinews take no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the great force of my disease my garment is changed; it binds me about as the collar of my coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has cast me into the mire, and I have become like dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me; I present myself, and thou regardest me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art become cruel to me; with the strength of thy hand thou dost hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou didst lift me up and cause me to ride upon the wind, and didst dissolve my being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that thou dost conduct me unto death and to the house appointed for all living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will not stretch out his hand against the grave; do those who are buried cry out when he destroys them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I not weep for the one that was in trouble? Was not my soul grieved for the needy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I expected good, then evil came unto me; and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bowels boil and do not rest; the days of affliction came upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went about darkened, but not by the sun; I stood up and cried out in the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have become a brother to dragons and a companion to owls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My harp is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of those that weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made a covenant with my eyes; why then should I look upon a maid?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what reward would God give me from above and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there no destruction for the wicked? And banishment for the workers of iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does he not see my ways and count all my steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have walked with falsehood or if my foot has hastened to deceit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let me be weighed in a just balance, that God may know my integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If my step has turned out of the way and my heart walked after my eyes and if any blot has cleaved to my hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let me sow, and let another eat, and let my offspring be rooted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If my heart has been deceived regarding a woman, or if I have laid in wait at my neighbour’s door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let my wife grind for another, and let others bow down upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is lewdness and iniquity that is proven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is a fire that consumes unto hell and would root out all my increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had despised the right of my manslave or of my maidslave, when they contended with me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what then would I do when God rises up? And when he visits, what would I answer him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not he that made me in the belly also make him? And did not the same one fashion us in the womb?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have disturbed the desire of the poor or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or have eaten my morsel alone and the fatherless has not eaten thereof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for from my youth the fatherless was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided the widow from my mother’s womb)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have seen any perish for want of clothing or any needy without a covering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if his loins have not blessed me and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, even when I saw that they would all help me in the gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let my back fall from my shoulder blade, and my arm be broken from its joint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I feared destruction from God, against whose highness I could have no power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have made gold my hope or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I rejoiced because my wealth was being multiplied, and because my hand had gotten much;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I beheld the sun when it shone or the moon walking in beauty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my heart has been secretly enticed, and my mouth kissed my hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this would also be a proven iniquity; for I should have denied the God that is sovereign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I rejoiced at the destruction of the one that hated me or lifted up myself when evil found him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have never even suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse upon his soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the servants of my tent said, Oh that we had of his flesh! We would never be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stranger did not lodge in the street, but I opened my doors to the traveller.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding my iniquity in my bosom;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I feared a great multitude or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and did not go out of the door?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh that someone would hear me! Behold, my mark is, that the Almighty will testify for me, even though my adversary had written down the charges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder and bind it as a crown to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince I would go near unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If my land cries against me and all its furrows likewise complain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I ate of its strength without money or have afflicted the soul of its owners;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let thistles grow up unto me instead of wheat and stinkweed instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the wrath of Elihu, the son of Barachel, the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram, was kindled; against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited until Job had spoken because they were all elder than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elihu, the son of Barachel, the Buzite, answered and said, I am younger, and ye are older; therefore, I was afraid, and I feared to declare unto you my opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said, Days shall speak, and the multitude of years shall declare wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly there is a spirit in man, and the inspiration of the Almighty gives them understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great men are not always wise; neither do the aged understand judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will declare my knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your arguments, while ye searched out what to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you to reprove Job or to answer his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom; it is needful that God thrust him down, and not man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he has not directed his words against me; neither will I answer him with your reasons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed, they answered no more; they left off speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I waited, (for they did not speak, but stopped, and answered no more);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said, I will also answer my part, I will also declare my opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am full of words; the spirit within me constrains me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which has no vent; it is ready to burst forth like spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will speak, that I may be able to breathe; I will open my lips and answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not now be a respecter of persons, neither will I give flattering titles unto man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not know how to give flattering titles; otherwise my maker would soon take me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, Job, hear now my reasons, and hearken to all my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, now I shall open my mouth, my tongue shall speak in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My reasons declare the uprightness of my heart; and my lips shall utter pure knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of God made me, and the breath of the Almighty gave me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead; I also am formed out of the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely thou hast spoken in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am clean without rebellion, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God sought occasions against me, he counts me for his enemy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he put my feet in the stocks, he guards all my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, in this thou art not just; I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why dost thou strive against him? For he will not answer all of thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, in one or two manners God speaks to the one who does not see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falls upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he opens the ears of men and seals their instruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he may withdraw the man from his own work and cover the man from pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he keeps back his soul from the pit and his life from perishing by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is chastened also upon his bed with strong pain in all his bones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that his life abhors bread and his soul dainty food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His soul shall draw near to the grave, and his life to those that would bury him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to show unto man his uprightness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to tell him that God had mercy on him, that he delivered him from going down to the pit; that he found a ransom;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his flesh shall become more tender than a child’s; and he shall return to the days of his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall pray unto God, and he will love him; and he shall see his face with shouts of joy; for he will render unto the man the recompense of his righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looks upon men, and if any say, I have sinned and perverted that which was right, and it did not profit me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God will ransom his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God does all these things two and three times with man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to turn back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear me, O Job, hearken unto me; be silent, and I will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou hast anything to say, answer me; speak, for I desire to justify thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If not, hearken unto me; be silent, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, Elihu answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ear tries words, as the mouth tastes food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us choose our judgment; let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Job has said, I am righteous; and God has taken away my right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In my judgment he was a liar, my arrow wound is grievous without my having committed a transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man is like Job, who drinks up the scorn like water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who goes in company with the workers of iniquity, and walks with wicked men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he said, It shall profit a man nothing that he should conform his will with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall pay man according to his work and cause every man to find according to his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who visited the earth for him? And who set the whole world in order?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he were to set his heart upon man and gather unto himself his spirit and his breath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all flesh would perish together, and man would turn again unto dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall even he that hates judgment govern? And wilt thou condemn the Mighty One that is righteous?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it fit to say to the king, Thou art of Belial and to the princes, Ye are ungodly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less to him who is not a respecter of the persons of princes, nor respects the rich more than the poor; for they all are the work of his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a moment they shall die, and the peoples shall be troubled at midnight and shall pass away; and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he sees all his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no darkness nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will not lay upon man more than that which is just; that he should enter into judgment with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number and set others in their stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, he shall cause their works to be notorious, when he shall overturn them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall strike them as wicked men in the open sight of others
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because thus they turned back from him and would not consider any of his ways
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he hears the cry of the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he gives rest, who then can make trouble? If he hides his face, who then can behold him? This applies to a nation and the same to a man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the hypocrite not reign, lest the people be ensnared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is of God to say, I have forgiven, I will no longer destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach me that which I do not see; if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he perchance finish his work by thee; whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose, or by me? Speak what thou knowest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of understanding will say as I say, and the wise man will hearken unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job has spoken without knowledge, and his words were without prudence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end, that there may be answers against wicked men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he added rebellion unto his sin, he claps his hands among us and multiplies his words against God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elihu proceeded in his reasoning and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou think this to be right, when thou didst say, I am more righteous than God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou didst say, What advantage will it be unto thee? And, What profit shall I have, if I am cleansed from my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will answer thee and thy companions with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look unto the heavens and see; and behold the heavens which are higher than thou.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou dost sin, what hast thou done against him? Or if thy rebellion is multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou art righteous, what shalt thou give him? Or what shall he receive of thine hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy wickedness shall hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness shall profit the son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By reason of the great violence they shall call out; they cry out because of the strength of the many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one shall say, Where is God my maker, who gives songs in the night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth and makes us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they shall cry, but he shall give no answer because of the pride of those that are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty look upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For much that thou dost say, he will not look upon it, submit to judgment before him, and trust thou in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, because he has not visited in wrath; nor is it known in great extremity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, Job opened his mouth in vain and multiplied words without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elihu added and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wait for me a little, and I will teach thee; for I yet speak on God’s behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will take my knowledge from afar and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly my words are not lies; for I share perfect knowledge with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God is mighty and does not despise; he is mighty in virtue of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not give life to the wicked; but to the poor he shall give their right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not withdraw his eyes from the righteous; but with kings he shall place them on the throne for ever, and they shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they were bound in fetters and captive in cords of affliction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he shall show them their work and that their rebellions prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He opens their ear to instruction and commands that they turn from iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they hearken and serve him, they shall spend their days in goodness and their years in delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they do not hearken, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hypocrites in heart shall irritate him more; they shall not cry out when he binds them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their soul shall die in youth, and their life is among the male pagan cult prostitutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall deliver the poor from his poverty, and in affliction shall open their ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, he would have removed thee out of the mouth of anguish into a broad place where there is no distress and should have set thy table full of fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked, against the judgment and the justice that sustain everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is to be feared that he take thee away with a stroke, which cannot be avoided even with a great ransom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he esteem thy riches? No, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not desire the night, when he cuts people off in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed, do not regard iniquity, to choose it rather than poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God is exalted by his power; what teacher is like him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has prescribed his way unto him? Or who shall say unto him, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember to magnify his work, which men behold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he detains the drops of water; when the rain pours down rain out of its vapour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall you understand the spreadings of the clouds or the noise of his tent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he spreads his light upon it and covers the roots of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by them he judges the peoples; he gives food to the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the clouds he covers the light and commands them to come against the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one gives news of the other; the one acquires wrath against the one that comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this also my heart trembles and is moved out of its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear attentively his terrible voice and the word that goes out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall place it straight under the whole of the heavens, and his light shall extend unto the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After it shall the sound roar; his valiant voice shall thunder; and he will not stay them even when his voice is heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God shall thunder marvelously with his voice; he does great things, which we cannot comprehend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; rain after rain, and rain after rain in his strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He seals up the hand of every man that all men may know his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the beast shall go into its lair and inhabit its dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the south comes the whirlwind and cold out of the north wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the breath of God ice is given; and the broad waters are constrained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition to this, with clarity he wearies the thick clouds; and he scatters them with his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they are turned round about by his counsels; that they may do whatever he commands them upon the face of the world in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On some occasions for correction, on others for his land, on others for mercy he causes them to appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto this, Job; stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou know when God disposed them and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of the one who is perfect in knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How thy garments are warm, when he quiets the earth by the south wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong and as a molten looking glass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach us what we should say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall it be told him when I speak? When someone is swallowed up shall it be told him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, sometimes the clear light which is in the heavens is not seen, but the wind passes and cleanses them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fair weather comes out of the north; with God is terrible majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out; he is excellent in power and in judgment, and in plenty of righteousness he will not afflict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men, therefore, shall fear him; all the crafty of heart shall not see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now gird up thy loins like a man; for I will enquire of thee, and answer thou me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? Cause me to know, if thou hast understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who ordered its dimensions, if thou knowest? Or who has stretched the line upon it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon what are its foundations founded? Or who laid its corner stone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I made the clouds its garment and thick darkness a swaddling band for it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and established my decree upon it, and set bars and doors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, Thou shalt come unto here, but no further; and there shall the pride of thy waves be stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days? Hast thou shown the dayspring its place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is transformed as clay to the seal and then stands as a garment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the light of the wicked is taken from them, and the high arm is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? Or hast thou walked searching out the deep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? Or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? Declare if thou knowest it all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the way to the habitation of the light, and where is the place of the darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou shalt take it in its borders, and if thou should understand the paths to its house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou didst know when thou wast to be born or if the number of thy days was to be great?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow, and hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By what way is the light divided; from where is the east wind scattered upon the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters or a way for the lightning of thunder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, in which there is no man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to satisfy the desolate and waste ground and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has the rain a father? Or who has begotten the drops of the dew?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of whose womb came the ice, and the hoary frost of heaven, who has begotten it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters harden as stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou bring forth the signs of the heavens in their season, or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou know the ordinances of the heavens? Canst thou use its power in the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go and say unto thee, Here we are?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who gave intelligence to understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who declared the heavens in wisdom? Or who can stay the bottles of heaven
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the dust hardens and the clods cleave fast together?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion or fill the appetite of the young lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they crouch in their dens and abide in their lairs to lie in wait?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who provided food for the raven; when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowest thou the time when the mountain goats bring forth? Hast thou observed when the hinds calve?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil, and knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How they crouch down, they bring forth their young ones, and dismiss their pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their young ones are healthy, they grow up with grain; they go forth and never return unto them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who freed the wild ass, and who loosed its bands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto whom I made a house in the wilderness, and his dwellings in the salty land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He laughs at the multitude of the city, neither does he hearken to the voice of the exactor of tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searches after every green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee or abide by thy crib?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? Will he harrow the valleys after thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou trust him because his strength is great? Or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou trust him, that he will bring home thy seed and gather it into thy barn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didst thou give beautiful wings unto the peacock, or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who leaves her eggs in the earth and warms them in dust
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forgets that the foot may crush them or that the wild beast may break them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers, not fearing that her labour is in vain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because God caused her to forget wisdom and did not give her understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In her time she lifts up herself on high; she scorns the horse and his rider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou given the horse strength? Hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou make him leap as a grasshopper? The glory of his nostrils is formidable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He paws at the earth and rejoices in his strength; he goes forth to meet the armed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He mocks fear and is not afraid; neither does he turn his face from the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The quiver rattles against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He swallows the ground with fierceness and rage; the sound of the shofar does not trouble him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the blasts of the shofar fill him with courage; he smells the battle afar off, the thunder of the princes and the sound of the battle-cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the hawk fly by thy industry and stretch her wings toward the south?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the eagle mount up at thy command and make her nest on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She dwells and abides on the rock upon the crag of the rock and the strong place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there she seeks food, and her eyes behold afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her young ones suck up the blood; and wherever the slain are, there she is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the LORD answered Job and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall he that contends with the Almighty instruct him? Let him that disputes with God answer this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the LORD and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay my hand over my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once I have spoken; but I will not answer; even twice, but I will proceed no further.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gird up thy loins now like a man; I will ask thee, and explain thou unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou disannul my judgment? Wilt thou condemn me, that thou may be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou an arm like God? And canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath; and behold every one that is proud and bring him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hide them in the dust together; and blindfold their faces in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eats grass as an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He moves his tail like a cedar; the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His bones are as strong as brass; his members are like bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the beginning of the ways of God; he that made him shall make his sword draw near unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall lie down under the shade, in the covert of the reeds and of the damp places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he shall drink up a river and not change; he trusts that he can draw up the Jordan into his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His maker shall take him by the weakness of his eyes in a snare, and pierce through his nose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou draw out leviathan with a hook or with the cord which thou lettest down on his tongue?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou put a hook into his nose or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he make many supplications unto thee? Will he speak soft words unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he make a covenant with thee that thou shall take him for a slave for ever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird, or wilt thou tie him up for thy maidens?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? Shall they part him among the merchants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou cut his skin with knives or his head with a fish spear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay thine hand upon him; thou shalt remember the battle and do no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your hope regarding him shall fail; for even at the sight of him they shall faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is so bold as to dare stir him up; who then shall be able to stand before me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has preceded me, that I should repay him? All that is under the whole heaven is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not conceal his lies, nor his might, nor the beauty of his order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shall uncover the face of his garment? Or who shall come to him with a double bridle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shall open the doors of his face? The orders of his teeth are terrible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His scales {Heb. shields} are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are joined one to another; they stick together, that they cannot be separated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his sneezings lights are lit, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of his nostrils goes forth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His breath kindles coals, and a flame goes out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his neck dwells strength, and before him the work is undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The failings of his flesh are joined together; his flesh is firm in him and does not move.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His heart is as firm as a stone; as hard as a piece of the lower millstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of his greatness, the mighty are afraid; by reason of breakings they remove sin from themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one catches up to him, no sword or spear or dart or coat of mail shall endure against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He esteems iron as straw and bronze as rotten wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The arrow cannot make him flee; with him, slingstones are turned into stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He counts any weapon as stubble; he laughs at the shaking of a spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Broken clay vessels are under him; he carves his imprint upon the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes the deep to boil like a pot; he makes the sea like a pot of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes the path shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon earth there is not his like, who behaves without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He despises all exalted things; he is king over all the sons of pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that thou canst do every thing and that there is no thought hidden from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is he that hides counsel without knowledge? Therefore, I have denounced that which I did not understand, things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, now, and I will speak; I will ask of thee, and thou shalt cause me to know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With my ears I had heard thee; but now my eyes see thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I abhor myself and repent in dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz, the Temanite, My wrath has been kindled against thee, and against thy two friends; for ye have not spoken by me in uprightness, as my slave Job has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my slave Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my slave Job shall pray for you; for only because I will accept him, I shall not deal with you according to your folly, in that ye have not spoken by me in uprightness, like my slave Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eliphaz, the Temanite, and Bildad, the Shuhite, and Zophar, the Naamathite, went, and did according as the LORD commanded them; and the LORD accepted Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends; also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all his brethren came unto him and all his sisters and all those that had been of his acquaintance before and ate bread with him in his house; and they condoled him and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him; each one also gave him an ewe, and an earring of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning; for he had fourteen thousand sheep and six thousand camels and a thousand yoke of oxen and a thousand she asses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also had seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of the first, Jemima, and the name of the second, Kezia, and the name of the third, Kerenhappuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in all the land no women were found as beautiful as the daughters of Job; and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Job lived one hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons’ sons, even four generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Job died, being old and full of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
